channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Go reminds public to remain vigilant despite GCQ
item.description: With most places in the country now under general community quarantine effective June 1, Sen. Bong Go reminded Filipinos to continue following health protocols and remain vigilant as the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) still remains a threat to everyone.

item.title: Calida, NTC chief attend House probe on ABS-CBN franchise
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: Solicitor General Jose Calida and National Telecommunications Commissioner commissioner Gamaliel Cordoba attended yesterday’s hearing of the House of Representatives on the franchise application of television giant ABS-CBN after they snubbed it on June 26 last year.

item.title: LGUs hedge on resumption of domestic flights
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Some local government units are opposed to the resumption of domestic flights over concerns about the possible spread of the coronavirus, officials said yesterday.

item.title: Remote enrollment off to good start — DepEd
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: Education Secretary Leonor Briones declared that remote enrollment for school year 2020-2021 for public school children an effort to prevent crowds from going to public schools was successful on its first day yesterday.

item.title: 14 labs still to submit results – DOH
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: A backlog of some 6,800 swab test results from 14 licensed laboratories have yet to be received by the Department of Health for validation.

item.title: DOH claims small victory vs COVID
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Department of Health yesterday said it had achieved a “small victory” in the fight against the coronavirus disease

item.title: PhilHealth: No delayed hospital payments
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The Philippine Health Insurance Corp. has denied the allegation of Private Hospitals Association of the Philippines Inc. that some 300 private hospitals are facing closure due to delayed payments by the state insurer.

item.title: Palace warns ECQ may be reimposed if…
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: As quarantine measures were eased nationwide yesterday, Malacañang warned the people that stricter protocols under another enhanced community quarantine could be reimposed if the public fails to observe safe physical distancing and health standards that would prevent the spread of the coronavirus.

item.title: GCQ day 1: Thousands stranded
item.author: Neil Jayson Servallos
item.description: Thousands of commuters mostly workers returning to their jobs were stranded yesterday in Metro Manila, as public transport remained limited despite the easing of restrictions for the first time after more than two months of Luzon-wide quarantine.

item.title: Roque: Premature to link Chinese-staffed POGOs, unregistered clinics for Chinese patients
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: "Let's not attribute anything because the industry has not resumed its operation," Roque said.
